00036 #include <stdio.h>
00037 #include <time.h>
00038 #include <sys/select.h>
00039 #include <unistd.h>
00040 #include <memory.h>

00042 #include "contiki.h"
00043 #include "contiki-net.h"

00045 #include "dev/serial-line.h"

00047 #include "net/uip.h"
00048 #ifdef __CYGWIN__
00049 #include "net/wpcap-drv.h"
00050 #else /* __CYGWIN__ */
00051 #include "net/tapdev-drv.h"
00052 #endif /* __CYGWIN__ */
00053 
00054 #ifdef __CYGWIN__
00055 PROCINIT(&etimer_process, &tcpip_process, &wpcap_process, &serial_line_process);
00056 #else /* __CYGWIN__ */
00057 PROCINIT(&etimer_process, &tapdev_process, &tcpip_process, &serial_line_process);
00058 #endif /* __CYGWIN__ */
00059 
00060 #if RPL_BORDER_ROUTER
00061 #include "net/rpl/rpl.h"
00062 
00063 uint16_t dag_id[] = {0x1111, 0x1100, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0x0011};
00064 
00065 PROCESS(border_router_process, "RPL Border Router");
00066 PROCESS_THREAD(border_router_process, ev, data)
00067 {
00068 
00069   PROCESS_BEGIN();
00070 
00071   PROCESS_PAUSE();
00072 
00073 { rpl_dag_t *dag;
00074   char buf[sizeof(dag_id)];
00075   memcpy(buf,dag_id,sizeof(dag_id));
00076   dag = rpl_set_root((uip_ip6addr_t *)buf);
00077 
00078 /* Assign separate addresses to the uip stack and the host network interface, but with the same prefix */
00079 /* E.g. bbbb::ff:fe00:200 to the stack and bbbb::1 to the host *fallback* network interface */
00080 /* Otherwise the host will trap packets intended for the stack, just as the stack will trap packets intended for the host */
00081 /* $ifconfig usb0 -arp on Ubuntu to skip the neighbor solicitations. Add explicit neighbors on other OSs */
00082   if(dag != NULL) {
00083     printf("Created a new RPL dag\n");
00084 
00085 #if UIP_CONF_ROUTER_RECEIVE_RA
00086 //Contiki stack will shut down until assigned an address from the interface RA
00087 //Currently this requires changes in the core rpl-icmp6.c to pass the link-local RA broadcast
00088 
00089 #else
00090 void sprint_ip6(uip_ip6addr_t addr);
00091     int i;
00092     uip_ip6addr_t ipaddr;
00093 #ifdef HARD_CODED_ADDRESS
00094     uiplib_ipaddrconv(HARD_CODED_ADDRESS, &ipaddr);
00095 #else
00096     uip_ip6addr(&ipaddr, 0xbbbb, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0x1);
00097 #endif
00098     uip_ds6_set_addr_iid(&ipaddr, &uip_lladdr);
00099     uip_ds6_addr_add(&ipaddr, 0, ADDR_AUTOCONF);
00100     rpl_set_prefix(dag, &ipaddr, 64);
00101 
00102         for (i=0;i<UIP_DS6_ADDR_NB;i++) {
00103           if (uip_ds6_if.addr_list[i].isused) {   
00104             printf("IPV6 Address: ");sprint_ip6(uip_ds6_if.addr_list[i].ipaddr);printf("\n");
00105           }
00106         }
00107 #endif
00108   }
00109 }
00110   /* The border router runs with a 100% duty cycle in order to ensure high
00111      packet reception rates. */
00112  // NETSTACK_MAC.off(1);
00113 
00114   while(1) {
00115     PROCESS_YIELD();
00116     /* Local and global dag repair can be done from ? */
00117  //   rpl_set_prefix(rpl_get_dag(RPL_ANY_INSTANCE), &ipaddr, 64);
00118  //   rpl_repair_dag(rpl_get_dag(RPL_ANY_INSTANCE));
00119 
00120   }
00121 
00122   PROCESS_END();
00123 }
00124 #endif /* RPL_BORDER_ROUTER */
00125 
00126 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6
00127 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00128 void
00129 sprint_ip6(uip_ip6addr_t addr)
00130 {
00131   unsigned char i = 0;
00132   unsigned char zerocnt = 0;
00133   unsigned char numprinted = 0;
00134   char thestring[40];
00135   char * result = thestring;
00136 
00137   *result++='[';
00138   while (numprinted < 8) {
00139     if ((addr.u16[i] == 0) && (zerocnt == 0)) {
00140       while(addr.u16[zerocnt + i] == 0) zerocnt++;
00141       if (zerocnt == 1) {
00142         *result++ = '0';
00143          numprinted++;
00144          break;
00145       }
00146       i += zerocnt;
00147       numprinted += zerocnt;
00148     } else {
00149       result += sprintf(result, "%x", (unsigned int)(uip_ntohs(addr.u16[i])));
00150       i++;
00151       numprinted++;
00152     }
00153     if (numprinted != 8) *result++ = ':';
00154   }
00155   *result++=']';
00156   *result=0;
00157   printf("%s",thestring);
00158 }
00159 #endif /* UIP_CONF_IPV6 */
00160 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00161 
00162 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00163 int
00164 main(void)
00165 {
00166   clock_init();
00167 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6
00168 /* A hard coded address overrides the stack default MAC address to allow multiple instances.
00169  * uip6.c defines it as {0x00,0x06,0x98,0x00,0x02,0x32} giving an ipv6 address of [fe80::206:98ff:fe00:232]
00170  * We make it simpler,  {0x02,0x00,0x00 + the last three bytes of the hard coded address (if any are nonzero).
00171  * HARD_CODED_ADDRESS can be defined in the contiki-conf.h file, or here to allow quick builds using different addresses.
00172  * If HARD_CODED_ADDRESS has a prefix it also applied, unless built as a RPL end node.
00173  * E.g. bbbb::12:3456 becomes fe80::ff:fe12:3456 and prefix bbbb::/64 if non-RPL
00174  *      ::10 becomes fe80::ff:fe00:10 and prefix awaits RA or RPL formation
00175  *      bbbb:: gives an address of bbbb::206:98ff:fe00:232 if non-RPL
00176 */
00177 //#define HARD_CODED_ADDRESS      "bbbb::20"
00178 #ifdef HARD_CODED_ADDRESS
00179 {
00180   uip_ipaddr_t ipaddr;
00181   uiplib_ipaddrconv(HARD_CODED_ADDRESS, &ipaddr);
00182   if ((ipaddr.u8[13]!=0) || (ipaddr.u8[14]!=0) || (ipaddr.u8[15]!=0)) {
00183     if (sizeof(uip_lladdr)==6) {  //Minimal-net uses ethernet MAC
00184       uip_lladdr.addr[0]=0x02;uip_lladdr.addr[1]=0;uip_lladdr.addr[2]=0;
00185           uip_lladdr.addr[3]=ipaddr.u8[13];;
00186           uip_lladdr.addr[4]=ipaddr.u8[14];
00187           uip_lladdr.addr[5]=ipaddr.u8[15];
00188    }
00189  }
00190 }
00191 #endif
00192 #endif
00193 
00194   process_init();
00195 /* procinit_init initializes RPL which sets a ctimer for the first DIS */
00196 /* We must start etimers and ctimers,before calling it */
00197   process_start(&etimer_process, NULL);
00198   ctimer_init();
00199 
00200   procinit_init();
00201   autostart_start(autostart_processes);
00202 
00203 #if RPL_BORDER_ROUTER
00204   process_start(&border_router_process, NULL);
00205   printf("Border Router Process started\n");
00206 #elif UIP_CONF_IPV6_RPL
00207   printf("RPL enabled\n");
00208 #endif
00209 
00210   /* Set default IP addresses if not specified */
00211 #if !UIP_CONF_IPV6
00212   uip_ipaddr_t addr;
00213   
00214   uip_gethostaddr(&addr);
00215   if (addr.u8[0]==0) {
00216     uip_ipaddr(&addr, 10,1,1,1);
00217   }
00218   printf("IP Address:  %d.%d.%d.%d\n", uip_ipaddr_to_quad(&addr));
00219   uip_sethostaddr(&addr);
00220 
00221   uip_getnetmask(&addr);
00222   if (addr.u8[0]==0) {
00223     uip_ipaddr(&addr, 255,0,0,0);
00224     uip_setnetmask(&addr);
00225   }
00226   printf("Subnet Mask: %d.%d.%d.%d\n", uip_ipaddr_to_quad(&addr));
00227 
00228   uip_getdraddr(&addr);
00229   if (addr.u8[0]==0) {
00230     uip_ipaddr(&addr, 10,1,1,100);
00231     uip_setdraddr(&addr);
00232   }
00233   printf("Def. Router: %d.%d.%d.%d\n", uip_ipaddr_to_quad(&addr));
00234 
00235 #else /* UIP_CONF_IPV6 */
00236 
00237 #if !UIP_CONF_IPV6_RPL
00238   uip_ipaddr_t ipaddr;
00239 #ifdef HARD_CODED_ADDRESS
00240   uiplib_ipaddrconv(HARD_CODED_ADDRESS, &ipaddr);
00241 #else
00242   uip_ip6addr(&ipaddr, 0xaaaa, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
00243 #endif
00244   if ((ipaddr.u16[0]!=0) || (ipaddr.u16[1]!=0) || (ipaddr.u16[2]!=0) || (ipaddr.u16[3]!=0)) {
00245 #if UIP_CONF_ROUTER
00246     uip_ds6_prefix_add(&ipaddr, UIP_DEFAULT_PREFIX_LEN, 0, 0, 0, 0);
00247 #else /* UIP_CONF_ROUTER */
00248     uip_ds6_prefix_add(&ipaddr, UIP_DEFAULT_PREFIX_LEN, 0);
00249 #endif /* UIP_CONF_ROUTER */
00250 #if !UIP_CONF_IPV6_RPL
00251     uip_ds6_set_addr_iid(&ipaddr, &uip_lladdr);
00252     uip_ds6_addr_add(&ipaddr, 0, ADDR_AUTOCONF);
00253 #endif
00254   }
00255 #endif
00256 
00257 #if !RPL_BORDER_ROUTER  //Border router process prints addresses later
00258 { uint8_t i;
00259   for (i=0;i<UIP_DS6_ADDR_NB;i++) {
00260         if (uip_ds6_if.addr_list[i].isused) {     
00261           printf("IPV6 Addresss: ");sprint_ip6(uip_ds6_if.addr_list[i].ipaddr);printf("\n");
00262         }
00263   }
00264 }
00265 #endif
00266 #endif /* !UIP_CONF_IPV6 */
00267 
00268   /* Make standard output unbuffered. */
00269   setvbuf(stdout, (char *)NULL, _IONBF, 0);
00270 
00271     printf("\n*******%s online*******\n",CONTIKI_VERSION_STRING);
00272 
00273   while(1) {
00274     fd_set fds;
00275     int n;
00276     struct timeval tv;
00277     
00278     n = process_run();
00279     /*    if(n > 0) {
00280       printf("%d processes in queue\n");
00281       }*/
00282 
00283     tv.tv_sec = 0;
00284     tv.tv_usec = 1;
00285     FD_ZERO(&fds);
00286     FD_SET(STDIN_FILENO, &fds);
00287     select(1, &fds, NULL, NULL, &tv);
00288 
00289     if(FD_ISSET(STDIN_FILENO, &fds)) {
00290       char c;
00291       if(read(STDIN_FILENO, &c, 1) > 0) {
00292         serial_line_input_byte(c);
00293       }
00294     }
00295     etimer_request_poll();
00296   }
00297   
00298   return 0;
00299 }
00300 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00301 void log_message(char *m1, char *m2)
00302 {
00303   printf("%s%s\n", m1, m2);
00304 }
00305 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00306 void
00307 uip_log(char *m)
00308 {
00309   printf("uIP: '%s'\n", m);
00310 }
00311 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00312 unsigned short
00313 sensors_light1(void)
00314 {
00315   static unsigned short count;
00316   return count++;
00317 }
